title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: To determine if a reaction is spontaneous, we need to look at the sign of the Gibbs free energy change, ∆G°. A negative ∆G° indicates a spontaneous reaction.

title: Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: The standard Gibbs free energy change, ∆G°, is given as $$-32.89$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$. What does the negative sign tell us about the reaction's spontaneity?

title: Temperature and Spontaneity
text: The temperature at which the reaction is considered is 298K. Does this temperature affect the spontaneity if ∆G° is already negative?

title: Comparing ∆G° to Zero
text: Compare the value of ∆G° to zero. If ∆G° is less than zero, the reaction is spontaneous under standard conditions.

title: Conclusion on Spontaneity
text: Based on the negative value of ∆G°, conclude whether the reaction is spontaneous at 298K.
